Text: Clean FuelsMitcham and I have discussed the relationship of Clean Fuels short natural gas position from the production of methanol and the long position of Transwestern created from fuel retention We have came to the conclusion that the two positions are not compatible Clean Fuels short position and gas consumption is directly related to their long methanol position In order for Clean Fuels to not speculate and maintain a balanced hedge a fixed price for natural gas and methanol is required Methanol is a very illiquid market and can not be hedged for longer than about three months out Because Tranwestern has a longer dated position the two risks can not be efficiently managed Another risk associated with incorporating the two positions is the location differential Clean Fuels purchases their volumes off of Houston Pipeline and is priced at a Houston Ship Channel index related price The value between the Houston Ship Channel and Transwestern routinely fluctuates making the pricing differential of the two positions somewhat difficult to manage As stated before because of liquidity issues timing issues and location differentials we feel that the positions can be better managed individually If market conditions change in the future incorporating the two positions can be revisited If you need any additional information please let me know

RE Mid to Mid Quote Cc Kevin Here are the rates that we came up with Please keep in mind that we may not have d available capacity at certain interconnects Also because of the California problems we have been able to extract additional value for volumes delivered to El Paso Waha Let me know if you need additional information Original Message From Hyatt Kevin Sent Wednesday July PM To Nielsen Jeff Subject RE Mid to Mid Quote Jeff can you fill in the rates for the and year terms for me These would be notional of course Let me know if you have questions thx Kevin Termyrs Demand Firm TI Volume is min to max of d plus minimum commodity Primary to El Paso Waha would be slightly higher Rates are plus fuel Original Message From Nielsen Jeff Sent Monday July PM To Hyatt Kevin Subject Mid to Mid Quote Kevin Jo Williams said that you needed a quote for transportation from Mid to Mid in the Waha area On a firm basis we would be would in the to demand range plus minimum commodity For a TI rate use between and If you would like primary to El Paso Waha that rate would be a little higher We have been able to get additional value out of that interconnect because of the gas prices in California Please let me know if you need any additional information Jeff
